1.content:
I'm Maisie Newell. I'm 9 years old and I live in Neverland.
You are probably wondering why and how I am living in Neverland
I'll tell you
This is my story
1.title: Intro

choices: We abruptly landed on the third star from morning
I woke up on the deck of the pirate ship
11.content:
I lived in an orphan school home and often had to protect the younger kids form bullies. The home used to belong to some family named Darling. Last year I found a hand printed story book in which a boy named Michael, told a story about this enchanted land and boy named Peter Pan. It was hidden away in a cranny in the wall. I have always loved fairy stories and after I read it I would sit by my window at night and wish on the first star that I could also have an adventure and maybe a family.

One night the star I wished on grew very bright and floated down to my window. When it landed I saw it was not a star at all but a blinking green fairy.

She hovered around me and said she was looking for her cousin Tinkerbell.

In her very high pitched voice she asked, "Is there a Wendy, John or Michael here?"

"They used to live here," I said ,"but have grown up and moved away."

'Oh dear," the fairly fluttered her wings in dismay. "We cannot find Tinkerbell and last we heard she was returning to this place. She wanted to find help for our boys! I know she was not fond of the Wendy but... Oh dear! Oh dear!"

"You are the first fairy I have ever seen." I said, "Are you from Neverland?. Do you know Peter Pan? Maybe I can help with the boys!" I was so excited to think that my wish might finally come true.

Er..well, maybe, but I came to find Tink! "

Suddenly, they heard a little screech and went into the hall. There they saw a tall boy holding a tiny ball of light by its wings and grinning. The little yellow fairy was struggling and and angry.

"Tony, put that creature down!" I went closer and whispered so as not to wake others.

"Why? It is only a butterfly. I want to pin it on a board like I saw in those butterfly books so I can dissect it." the boy said.

Realizing that he did not see the fairy she continued. "That is mean. Now let it go!”

At the same moment the green fairy flew at his head! He was so surprised he released Tinkerbell, who also started to pull his hair. He started flailing his arms to swat at them and backed off down the hall.

I called them back and closed the door of the room. Tink looked at her cousin and said, "what are you doing here?" She didn't look too happy, considering we had just saved her life.

"Peter sent me as you went off in a huff, again! You have been gone along time. We couldn't even follow your fairy dust trail!"


"Humpff! Well I miscalculated and it took me awhile to get here and then this.. this...boy wouldn't let me go! Our fairy magic seems a bit off.”

"Yes, exactly, that is what Peter said.”

“So I came to find the Wendy. I thought maybe if we could get more folks from her world to believe again..."Tinkerbell sighed.

"I know, but there is no Wendy any more. But this girl sees us and can even understand our speech!" the green fairy's eyes suddenly widened, as she realized what she said.

"Really?" Tinkerbell flew up to my eye level.

“She also handled that boy quite well and knows about Neverland so maybe ..”

“So girl, you can hear us?”

“Yes, actually. And I really would love to go to Neverland.” I was still marvelling at the fact I was speaking with fairies.

Tinkerbell considered and then figured one girl was as good as another. “Ok, then. Peter really does need help.”

Now things may not be exactly as you have heard.” whispered the green fairy as she prepared her portion of fairy dust for the journey.

Tink instructed me to think the happiest thoughts I could think of so I could fly and then they cousin blew the fairy dust. I did not believe for a moment it would not work in spite of what Tink said about the magic.

We flew through the window and in spark of time…
11.title: Continue

114.content:
Oh no, I thought as soon as I realised here we'd landed. I thought we would be at the den, or the lagoon. Not this dreadful place.

I looked around me as I stood up, taking in my surrounding. The pirate ship was huge, netting reaching high up to the masts, the sails were down. I could hear the sound of laughter coming from below deck. I gulped.

"Come on," urged Tink's cousin. "We have to get out of here now."

I wasn't about to disagree. I tiptoed as gently as I could, following the two sprightly fairies as they led the way to get off the ship. I had just about made it, the steep gangway in sight, when the board I stepped on let out an almighty groan. I froze on the spot.

The laughter below the deck stopped instantly and was replaced with a deathly silence. Then all of a sudden, what seemed like everyone who had been below deck raced up to see what intruder was on their ship. I was frozen with fear, my legs would not work. Even when I saw them coming at me, ugly, leering faces sneering at me. The one in front held out a long sword pointed in my direction. His bulbous belly hung over his tattered pants.

"Get her boys," the pirate instructed. Without further ado several of the men rushed forward and grabbed me, trusting me up tight with a section of rope. It burnt into my skin.

There was no sight of the fairies.

"Good, now go and get Hook," Smee instructed once more, a smirk crossing his cracked lips.

Hook. Oh no.

I knew what that meant. Hook was the worst pirate known to Neverland, he was harsh and ruthless. He had tried many times to kill Peter Pan without succeeding, though I was sure he wouldn’t have trouble killing me.

The crowd of pirates parted just then as a tall man wearing red clothing marched across to where I was tired. He had huge black locks of hair and a moustache that twirled. I found myself wondering how he got it to stay like that.

“Well, well,” he lifted my chin with his finger. “What have we have?”

I felt like an animal on show.

“A trespasser, sir,” Smee answered, eager to please. He was almost bouncing with joy.

“So I see,” Hook nodded thoughtfully. “And what do we do with trespassers Smee?”

“We make them walk the plan!” Smee’s smirk transformed into a gleeful giggle. He was enjoying himself.

“Get on with it then!” Hook roared. Flustered, Smee grabbed me and rushed me over to the plank, untying my ropes before setting me loose.

“Go on then,” he pushed me forward, his sword at my back. I felt it nick my skin drawing blood.

I gulped and look down, readying myself to face my doom when…
114.title: I woke up on the deck of the pirate ship

choices: "Yes, I will be your mother, for a short while."
11412.content:
"Who's this?" one of the boys prodded me with his finger.

"Ow!" I yelled in protest jumping from Peter's arms. "Stop it!" I scolded him.

Instead of apologising like I expected him to do, the boy stuck out his tongue at me.

"Lost Boys," Peter addressed them all, commanded instant attention. They all fell silent as they waited for Peter's words. "This is Maisie," he pointed at me, smiling broadly.

"She's a girl!" one of them began complaining, his face twisting into a frown.

"Yeah, why'd you bring a girl here?" another one moaned, throwing his hands across his chest.

"Hey! Now stop it!" Peter shouted. Immediately the Lost Boys grew silent, though none of them looked happy. "Maisie is here to be our mother."

"A mother? I don't need no mother!" the first boy shook his head vigourously and slumped on the floor.

"Oh but you do, we all do," Peter nodded his head. "Isn't that right, Maisie?"

I went to this primary school called Great Budworth Primary School.
I had a teacher called Mrs Goodchild and another teacher called Miss Shaw.
I was easily picked on because of my size and I liked to be alone. I was also an orphan so I was picked on for that reason as well.
My best friend was Millie Pye.
Anyways it was raining all day and it had stopped raining at lunchtime.
I was behind the castle just thinking about things when it started to rain again.
I ran for the door to go inside and I found out it was locked.
I couldn't get in.
Jan and Rhys must have done it.
I didn't know this at the time.

I sat down in a corner and I put my head into my knees and for some reason I started to cry.
